This outbreak is the third time in the past two decades that a zoonotic coronavirus has crossed species to infect humans. During the epidemics of the other two beta-coronaviruses (severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus [SARS-CoV] and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus [MERS-CoV]), > 10,000 cumulative cases occurred, with lethality rates of 10% for SARS-CoV and 37% for MERS-CoV.
